Visualization¶

handwriting.utils.visualization_utils.get_stroke_arrays(stroke)[source]¶

Utility to split a (n, 3) stroke array

Parameters:stroke (np.array) – input stroke
Returns:stroke line x coordinates x (np.array): stroke line y coordinates cuts (np.array): indicates where the pen is lifted
Return type:x (np.array)
handwriting.utils.visualization_utils.plot_conditional(settings, plot_data, fig_name)[source]¶

Grid plot showing phi, attention window, density and sampled stroke

Parameters:
  • settings (ExperimentSettings) – custom class holding parameters of interest
  • plot_data (PlotData) – custom class holding plotting data
  • fig_name (str) – path where to save figure
handwriting.utils.visualization_utils.plot_stroke(stroke, save_name=None)[source]¶

Utility to plot a single stroke, optionally saving it

Parameters:
  • stroke (np.array) – input stroke
  • save_name (str) – save a figure with name = save_name
handwriting.utils.visualization_utils.plot_stroke_from_batch(X_var, Y_var)[source]¶

Utility to plot a stroke from a torch batch Useful for debugging training

Parameters:
  • X_var (torch Variable) – batch of strokes
  • Y_var (torch Variable) – batch of strokes incremented by 1 in stroke steps
handwriting.utils.visualization_utils.plot_stroke_on_axis(ax, stroke)[source]¶

Utility to plot a stroke on a given axis

Parameters:
  • ax (matplotlib axis) – a matplotlib axis
  • stroke (np.array) – input stroke
handwriting.utils.visualization_utils.plot_stroke_with_text(settings, data)[source]¶

Utility to plot a stroke with corresponding text

We verify that we recover the text from the onehot encoding

Parameters:
  • settings (ExperimentSettings) – custom class holding parameters of interest
  • data (list) – list containing an aray of strokes, str texts and onehot encoding of the text.
